"Excuse me."

"Yes madam. How can I help you?"

"My dragon died yesterday. I need a new one."

"Your... dragon?"

"Well we have a very good reptiles section...."

"I've already been there," the frustrated girl replied. "What I need is a dragon. Doesn't your store slogan say 'for ALL your animal needs'?"

"Well yes, madam, but... let me just call my manager."

The girl smiled evilly, "Now where do you think you're going?"

1121.content:
Samantha stared for some time at the first item on her list. "Hair of the abominable snowman," she half-murmured to herself, as if actually saying the words would somehow make an answer appear out of nowhere. She nervously tapped her pencil against the table and wondered how someone from her small town would come across such an item, since Yeti sightings in her quiet neighbornood had occured, well, never to be honest. She realized she would have to find a suitable alternative, some sort of faux-Yeti that while accessible to her would still please the gods of the spirit world, who were known to be a picky lot. Her attempts to substitute eye of newt with oregano during one particularly trying spell had met with such disaster that her fellow sorcerers still chuckled about it.

"Hey, Samantha, I'm out of wolfbane. Got any allspice?"

Then it came to her, as if a cauldron of hot goat's blood has spilled on her foot. She remembered Mr. Pitts, a local handyman of some reknown, mostly because of his severe lack of any real sense of hygene. A plethora of odors usually greeted anyone within two hundred paces of him (that was with the wind blowing away), his skin, at least the parts that were not covered with thick hair, was mottled with lesions from diseases that quite possibly only he carried and his clothes were covered with stains of a highly questionable origin. But his work was of the highest quality, whether it involved the creation of impeccable lawns, or, as Samantha recalled, his precise removal of snow from sidewalks and driveways in the winter, a skill that had earned him the nickname "The Snowman" from the neighborhood children.

Yes, he was a "snowman", thought Samantha. And he certainly was "abominable". And enough hair covered his back that she could probably take enough clumps for two incantations. As she visualized his hovel at the end of the street, its less-than-secure front door, its broken side window, she found herself reaching for the scissors on her bureau and heading outside.

The wagon had a cage on the back. In the cage was a youth about seventeen years old wearing green tights, with a brown pull-over shirt, a matching green hat with a feather in it and leather moccasin-type shoes.

Kevin jumped out of the bushes, "Excuse me, sir, could you tell me..."

With that the horse reared up and bolted towards a large oak tree, throwing the driver off and banging the wagon and cage into the tree leaving the driver unconscious.

Mr. J. ran over to the old man to find that he was alright except for a nasty cut to the right side of his head. He wrapped a piece of cloth around the wound and carefully laid the man against the tree until he would regain consciousness.

The boy in the cage got up with both hands on his head and said in an English accent, "What happened? Who are you and why are you dressed so strangely?"

"I'm Kevin, this is my boss, Mr. Jacobson and we don't know where we are. The last thing we remember is a strange lady dressed in black telling us that her dragon died."

"I'm Ian. Pleased to meet you. Was this woman wearing a ring with a large red stone on her right hand?"

Kevin thought for a minute and Mr. J. blurted,
"Why, yes, she was. I thought it odd that a woman dressed in such ragged clothing would be wearing such an expensive looking ring."

"Oh my," replied Ian, "That was Delia the witch. Sir Gwain slayed her dragon when it breathed fire and destroyed the home of his love, Katherine, and killed her father. Delia has many powers. She can change her looks and become anything she desires. She can even travel through time into the past."

"Well, I guess that explains how we got here." replied Kevin. "We are from the future and she has brought us here but I don't know why. By the way, why are you in that cage?"

"Delia made false charges and had me imprisoned for revenge against Sir Gwain. She has no power over him."

"But why you?" replied Kevin.

"Sir Gwain is my father."

"I found the keys to the cage!" said Mr. J. "They were on the driver's belt.

Kevin unlocked the cage and freed Ian.

"My father is preparing me for the knighthood and when I become a knight, Delia will have no power over me, either."

Just then they saw a dark figure walking towards them from a distance on the other side of a grove of trees.

"It's Delia!" exclaimed Ian.

His words echoed back to him louder than he had spoken. They both covered their ears. Mr Jacobson turned to head back outside and gasped. Tendrils of smoke curled around the edges of the front door.

"Hello? We need some help!" Kevin called out, louder this time, and covered his ears.

This is why he missed the reply. His boss smacked him on the shoulder and he took his hands from his ears.

"What?" he asked.

"Did you hear that?"

"No. What was it?" Kevin asked, not sure he wanted to know the reply.

"Something said to come upstairs..."

They both gazed at the rickety wooden staircase and winced. Kevin looked at his boss. Mr Jacobson glared back at him.

"Well? What are you waiting for? Up you go!"

"Why me?" Kevin asked.

"Because I'm your boss and you do as I say. Now go up those stairs and find out who's there!"
12211.title: Inside the House

choices: Heads - Mr Jacobson goes upstairs
Tails - Kevin goes upstairs
122112.content:
"No way! I'm not going," Kevin replied, as he folded his arms tightly across his chest.

"Right, well then, I suppose we're going to die..." his boss replied dryly as he rolled his eyes and glanced at the smoking door.

Kevin bit his lip and swallowed hard.

"T-t-toss a coin? Heads you go upstairs, tails, I do?"

Mr Jacobson smirked and nodded.

Kevin searched his pockets. "I, um, I don't have a coin..."

"I do..." his boss chuckled as he threw it in the air, caught it and placed it on the back of his hand.

Kevin eagerly peered over his boss' shoulders to see the result.

It was...
122112.title: Head or Tails?

choices: Go with the old man
Run
1222.content:
Kevin and Mr. Jacobson made it about five feet before they felt heat at their backs. Then Mr. Jacobson disappeared as he was instantly incinerated by a blast of flame.

         The blast was so powerful that Kevin was knocked ten feet through the air. He came down hard on his left side - leaving that arm sore. His right side was not much better. That half of his face and arm was red, as if sunburned and all the hair was missing from his right arm.

         Through the cloud of pain and confusion he smelled the faint odour of smoldering cloth.

         "Bad boy, Skippy. Bad boy. How many times have I told you not to incinerate your toys."

         The voice was coming from the direction of the house they had seen earlier.

         "Are ya' okay young feller?" Kevin lay in the grass unsure what to do.

         "Well, Skippy, I guess ya killed 'im, you might a well eat 'im." Kevin heard the dragon stomping over to him.

         "I'm okay! I'm alive! Don't let him eat me!" Kevin screamed as he jumped up.

         "I knew you was alive young feller - I just didn't feel like playing possum all day."

         For the first time Kevin saw the source of the voice. It was an old man with a long grey beard wearing an old, dirty, many times patched grey robe.

         "Sorry about your friend."

         "That's okay, he wasn't my friend. He was my boss."

         "Well, do you want to come over to my house, I'll get ya patched up."
1222.title: Smells like barbequed dog hair

choices: The old man is Kevin's long lost father
The old man is the spiritual guardian of Dragons and Witches
12221.content:
The dragon was sniffing at Mr. Jacobson's corpse, wondering perhaps where was best to start on his meal. Any exit from the house involved getting past the dragon so Kevin decied it was an excellent idea to follow the dirty old man.

The old man walked onwards through the gloom not looking back and turned left through a doorway. Kevin followed. The room he entered was a great library or perhaps a great lounge, but certainly a great surprise. A cheerful log fire burned in a gigantic stone fireplace around which were several very comfortable looking, old, red leather sofas.

Virtually none of the deep green walls could be seen between the extensive bookshelves loaded with ancient and modern books. Gaps were filled with a tasteful collection of modern art. Several pieces looked like Picasso to someone of Kevin's artistic ignorance.

Ambient light was provided by discreet spotlights around the room.

In one of the red leather sofas the old man was sitting, or was he? He now wore a spotless white tee-shirt and blue jeans, Calvin Klein if Kevin wasn't mistaken. The matted grey hair was still grey, but now it was shiny and carefully groomed and clearly expensively cut to collar length. And wasn't that a Rolex?

"Please sit down Kevin and relax for a moment. Can I pour you some coffee? Milk? Sugar? And please close your mouth, your chin is hanging on your chest."

Kevin sat.

"Mmm I see you're a bit shocked. I'll take a chance and give you milk and plenty of sugar then."

"Who are you?" croaked Kevin.

"And how do you know my name," he added as an afterthought. Although in truth he was in too great a state of shock to have many coherent thoughts at all.
12221.title: A Meeting of Importance

choices: Kevin and Mr. Jacobson try the fruit
RUN!
123.content:
Kevin shook his head. "Weird..." he thought. "I must be asleep... yes, that's it, I'm having a dream."

Suddenly, Mr Jacobson grabbed Kevin's arm and yanked him. "Look out!" he exclaimed just as a larger-than-life piece of fruit fell to the ground with a thud.

"What IS that?" Kevin exclaimed, clearly shaken by his brush with near mishap. "How sohuld I know?" Mr. Jacobson answered. He was clearly perturbed.

Just then, the girl from the pet store climbed down from the tree. "Anyone hungry?" She asked as she began to tear into the large fruit.

Kevin and Mr. Jacobson stood there stunned.
123.title: A Dream?

choices: Investigate the tree some more
Get away from it - fast!
124.content:
It was not the not knowing that most bothered Kevin. It was that the reply had not come from Mr. Jacobson but appeared to be coming from a tree they were lying a few feet from.

"What, you've never seen a talking tree before?" the tree responded to his not so subtle staring. Kevin knew he must be hallucinating, as it even appeared to have a hole shaped like a mouth....

"Look, stop gawping and get off my roots would you? Some people..." the tree told him irritably.

"Erm.... where are we?" Kevin asked, edging away from the tree.

"You think I know? I don't get about much you know - you think it's easy just going for a wander looking like this?" the tree replied.
124.title: Out of his tree

choices: Run for it!
Stay where you are- after all, she's the only one that can take you home.
1241.content:
"Sorry," Kevin muttered. Turning back to Mr. Jacobson, he said, "That girl must have sent us here. She was freaky. Maybe she drugged us or something, to make us hallucinate."

Mr. Jacobson shook his head slowly, not looking at Kevin. "She didn't drug us. We are here."

"Wha-what do you mean?"

The manager forced himself to face Kevin. "That girl," he said, "is my sister. I haven't seen her in years, not since she started to study magic."

"Magic?" Kevin was confused.

"Yes, magic. One day she phoned me to say she was joining a group of witches. I told her it was a bunch of nonsense, and that she should get herself a real occupation."

"And what do you think about it now?" Mr. Jacobson and Kevin started. The girl walked up from behind them and looked at them both, with an expression on her face that neither could quite understand.
1241.title: Magic in the air

choices: Go North - to the enchanted city
Go South - to mystic caverns
1242.content:
"Erm... right... nice speaking to you, bye!" said Kevin, following Mr. Jacobson, who was already rapidly departing.

It was clearly a dream, Kevin reassured himself. Trees don't talk, he must have banged his head when he fell on the ground. He decided to avoid questionning how he ended up away from Petsworld and in the field in the first place, and concentrate on getting back home.

Kevin saw a sign post up ahead. At last! Now he could finally get home.
1242.title: Directions

choices: Follow Kevin
Follow the girl
Meanwhile, elsewhere in the universe
13.content:
Honestly, customer service these days! For no other reason than to teach the boy a lesson, she decided to turn him into a toad. Really it was quite comical watching him hop around the store floor....

"Now, where shall I put you? Amphibians and repltiles, or in the big pond with the goldfish?" she asked Kevin.

Sadly however, Kevin was now just an ordinary toad rather than a magical one and incapable of replying that what he would really like would be to turned back into a human again. So he had the dubious pleasure of being placed on the floor in the amphibians and reptiles aisle.

"Now off you go!"
13.title: It's not easy being green

choices: The child's mother orders the child drops him
Kevin is carried away
131.content:
Kevin was terrified. He couldn't understand how he had suddenly gone from a 5'9" human being to a small toad. His brain tried to refuse to accept it, but then another part of his brain warned him of the inevitable. Petsworld didn't sell toads, and if he sat in the aisle much longer he was destined to either be run over or cruely tortured by bored staff members.

Hopping as fast as his new legs would carry him Kevin proceeded in the direction the girl had departed in. However, it was a strange new world he was facing and nothing like the Petsworld he had once known.

"Aw... aren't you cute?"

Kevin felt the large sticky fingers closing around him at the same time as hearing the impossibly loud child like voice. Surely life couldn't be that cruel to him? But obviously it could as Kevin was now in the hands of a young child.
131.title: A whole new and much larger world

choices: Hop to the delivery bay
Get stopped on route
1311.content:
Kevin breathed a croak of relief as he heard a voice instruct the child to put him down. Being stuck as a frog in Petsworld was hardly a good thing, but being the property of a small girl was much worse.

As quick as his legs could carry him he hopped around Petsworld but the girl who had turned him into a frog had vanished. How was he going to turn back into a human again?

Just then, a flash of inspiration hit him. Of course! His mother had read him the old fairytales when he was a child. What he needed was a princess to kiss him.

The problem was what princess was going to kiss a slimy green frog? Not to mention where was he going to find a princess! He supposed Buckingham Palace would be the best bet for finding royalty.... There was a delivery bay at the back of the store where trucks arrived - hopefully he could get onto one of those and hope if was going in the right direction. There were definitely Petsworld superstores in London, a truck would have to go there sooner or later!
1311.title: Things can only get... worse!

choices: The truck goes to London
The truck goes to France
13111.content:
The journey to the delivery bay was a long and arduous one. In normal time it would just have taken Kevin a minute or two but as a toad it was a much longer journey, full of huge obstacles. The most major of these, of course, was the danger of being trodden on by the customers.

Even when Kevin arrived at the door out of the main store, he realised the difficulty of his task. For a toad cannot open a door by itself! Thankfully a member of staff carrying boxes entered through the door soon enough and Kevin was able to hop through unoticed and towards the loading bay narrowly avoiding being squashed by Dave, the warehouse manager.

Kevin saw a load of boxes waiting to be loaded and thankfully hopped in. At last he was safe!
13111.title: The incredible journey

choices: Kevin meets another frog
Kevin attempts to find another mode of transport
131112.content:
The journey was pure torture for Kevin, so he was glad when the back of the truck was finally opened again. Anything to get out of that bumpy atmosphere!

Going towards the end of the tailboard, he looked carefully out to see where he was. There was no signs to say "Welcome to Petsworld..." but he was of the opinion that anywhere would be better than that truck for now.

"Oi! Hop it," a large voice said, coming from above him, as a large hand swatted him off the truck and onto the concrete below. It was a wonder the fall didn't kill him!

"Very funny. A frog... hop it," another voice replied, "but what else do you expect this is France after all."

If frogs were not already cold blooded animals, Kevin's blood would have gone cold that very instant. Not France, surely fate couldn't be that cruel....

The tailboard was too far above for Kevin to jump back up, so unless he found a way out he might soon be dinner for some Frenchman!
131112.title: Frogs' Legs

choices: Kevin arrives at their home
Kevin must attempt to escape
1312.content:
As the girl held him, a shadow fell across Kevin's face.

"Come on Grace, we have to go," said a tall boy.

"But Eddie," whined Grace, "Look what I found."

"Gracie, you know Mom won't let you keep that," scolded Eddie, but his eyes softened at Grace's pleading eyes.

"Here, put him in my backpack," Eddie said with an exasparated sigh. Hurriedly, Grace jammed Kevin into the pack and he was carried out of the store.
1312.title: Into the World

choices: Kevin attempts to befriend the creature
Kevin tries to escape before the creature can attack him
13121.content:
After a harrowing journey, where Kevin was bumped and bruised inside the backpack, a crack of light appeared as the pack was unzipped. Kevin was then unceremoniously lifted by one leg and dumped into a large aquarium.

"You can play with him later," said the boy. "Anyway, Mom would kill us if she saw we brought home another pet."

Those words left an unpleasant chill on Kevin's slimy skin. H e suddenly realized he was not alone. A pair of glowing, yellow eyes peered out at him from some artificial shrubbery.
13121.title: Friend or Foe?

choices: Kevin finds a loose seam.
There are no loose seams... Kevin is taken back to Grace's house.
13122.content:
Kevin scrambled frantically at the rough material - all he had to see by was a slit of light where the zip was still slightly open. It was crowded in the bag and cookie crumbs were sticking to his slimy skin, but he couldn't do anything about it. He tried yelling, but being a toad nothing came out except a rather deep croak.

'Doomed to a life of fly-munching...' thought Kevin mournfully. Then he had an idea. They always did it in the movies - the lead character got shrunk and had to fight their way out of someone's bag... there had to be a loose seam here somewhere...
13122.title: Doomed for eternity...?

choices: She goes with her cousin
She goes to Mars
132.content:
The girl dressed in black, Darky, left the pet store, still mad at Kevin, how dare he say they had a pet for all needs when they didn't even have a dragon?

"I've had enough of human petshops," she thought, "Now I'll really have to look for a dragon on Mars..."

Darky walked to a phonebooth, turned the person who was calling there into a fly and closed the door. She dialed a number, hung up and a flying broom appeared in front of her. Darky the Black jumped on the broom and flew off.

The girl flew over the city to the countryside, until she came to a high mountain with what seemed to be a hole, or a cave, where she landed. Standing in front of the hole was a girl that looked a lot like Darky, but she was red instead of black.

"Cousin Linda! Nice to see you! I'm so mad today, Smokie died yesterday and I can't find another dragon!"

Linda the Red just looked at Darky and started laughing. "You silly, were you in the city? Mortals don't have such animals as dragons!"

"Now you tell me.... But what brings you here, cousin?"

"Merlin called us all to a meeting tonight. He said it's important, everybody is going there."

"But I have to go to Mars to buy a new dragon, you know how lonely I get without a pet."
132.title: A Guest For The Black Girl

choices: Speak to some of the other people
Explore the darker recesses of the cave
1321.content:
"Honestly, you can do it anytime - this is important!" Linda replied.

"Okay," Darky begrudgingly accepted. Besides which if anyone would know how to find a dragon, it would be Merlin.

The meeting was to be held at Alderley Edge in Cheshire this time, one of a variety of locations throughtout England that Merlin favoured. By the time Linda and Darky arrived there were already several others waiting in the underground cave they used as a meeting room.

"Won't be a minute, just have to talk to Medina over there," said Linda, abandoning Darky in favour of a green clad woman with twigs in her hair.
1321.title: The underground cave

choices: Medina puts a curse on her
she gets lost in the darkness
13212.content:
Instead of returning to Darky, Medina talked Linda into exploring the darker recesses of the cave. Now, Darky had warned Linda not to stray away from the crowd, but Medina was so very convincing.

As the two wandered into the deep darkness Linda began to get very uneasy. She tried to tell Medina she was ready to go back to the group, but Medina would have no part of it. She told her the dragon was there, she could feel it in her gut, and she would continue with or without her.

Linda decides she is going to go back anyway. If she follows the voices off in the distance she can make it back to Darky and feel safe again. She sets off towards the entrance and
13212.title: Explore the darker recesses of the cave

choices: Kevin listens to Serepticia intently.
Kevin pretends very hard to listen, but does not.
Kevin makes a run for it. She IS crazy.
Serepticia is interupted by a noise and fails to tell Kevin
Something else
15.content:
The girl in black seized Kevin and pulled him through a doorway; was it there before?

The door slammed shut, the light of the store vanished in an instant. The pair began to fall rapidly in the absolute darkness. Kevin's screaming lungs came to an echoed silence as his feet finally hit the ground, all the remaining air knocked out of him. Kevin fell to the floor to find it cold and wet.

"What is your name, boy?" came the girl's voice, still beside him.

"Kevin, who are you?" he demanded, "Where am I?" Kevin slowly picked himself and his aching limbs up off the floor and groaned.

"My name is Serepticia. Welcome to Dragonhal, my home."

The clearly 'crazed' girl lit a torch, no, her hand! There she stood, in a slight pose, her palm held up to the sky or ceiling, or whatever. The flames were sitting delicately above it like a gas ring on the hob. Serepticia looked at him hard.

"Mr Kevin. I need your help. It's important that you pay attention now, or you could get hurt."
15.title: Dragonhal - Home of Serepticia
